title: Fort Lee renamed in honor of 2 Black US Army trailblazers
description: Fort Lee was renamed Fort Gregg-Adams in honor of two Black U.S. Army trailblazers during a redesignation ceremony Thursday.

title: Mike Pence testifies before special counsel grand jury
description: Pence has critical insight into Trump following his loss in the 2020 election.

title: 'Extremely dangerous' tornado confirmed in Florida amid severe weather threat
description: A large and "extremely dangerous" tornado was confirmed in Florida Thursday amid a severe weather threat in much of the state.

title: Illinois man using leaf blower shot, killed by neighbor in his own driveway
description: According to the Lake County Sheriff's Office, William Martys was found dead in his driveway around 7:35 p.m. on April 12 with a gunshot wound to his head.

title: WATCH:  Watch grandma’s hilarious reaction to granddaughter dyeing her hair bright colors
description: Warning: Her laugh is contagious.

title: Teen arrested in fatal shooting of transgender woman featured in documentary
description: A teenager has been arrested in connection with the fatal shooting of transgender woman Rasheeda Williams, aka Koko Da Doll, in Atlanta.

title: Colorado rock-throwing suspect took photo of victim's car 'as a memento'
description: One of three teens accused of throwing large rocks toward at least seven cars allegedly took a photo of their final victim's car after hitting it "as a memento."

title: Police looking for man accused of abducting, sexually assaulting women
description: Memphis police are looking for a man who abducts and in some cases sexually assaults young females.

title: One-third of teen girls in US seriously considered attempting suicide in 2021: CDC
description: A new report from the CDC Thursday found the percentage of U.S. teen girls seriously considering suicide rose from 2019 to nearly one-third in 2021.

title: Jim Justice to announce Senate bid, setting up potential 'nailbiter' with Joe Manchin
description: West Virginia Gov. Jim Justice is set to announce a Senate campaign Thursday, setting up a potential challenge to incumbent Sen. Joe Manchin

title: Washington state shields people seeking abortion, trans care
description: Washington state has enacted legal protections for people who travel there seeking reproductive and gender-affirming medical care

title: Railroad workers rescue 3-year-old from tracks in New York
description: Officials say a New York railroad conductor sprinted to scoop up a 3-year-old boy who had wandered onto the tracks

title: Israeli army kills alleged Palestinian attacker in West Bank
description: Authorities say Israeli security forces have shot and killed a suspected Palestinian assailant in the West Bank

title: Carolyn Bryant Donham, whose accusations led to murder of Emmett Till, dies at 88
description: Carolyn Bryant Donham, whose accusations led to murder of Emmett Till, has died at 88.

title: 'Jackass' star Bam Margera in court, denies hitting brother
description: “Jackass” star Bam Margera has surrendered to Pennsylvania State Police for allegedly punching his brother during an altercation four days earlier at their home in the Philadelphia suburbs

title: US to open foreign centers in bid to stop migration surge
description: The Biden administration will open migration centers in Guatemala and Colombia for asylum seekers heading to the U.S.-Mexico border in a bid to slow what’s expected to be a surge of migrants seeking to cross the border as pandemic-era immigration restr...

title: Gap cuts 1,800 corporate jobs amid sales slump
description: Gap is laying off 1,800 corporate workers, roughly three time the number it laid off last fall as the struggling chain cuts costs in a bid to become more nimble

title: WATCH:  Giant panda cub tries to give hugs and kisses to keeper
description: A giant panda cub in China saw his feeder approaching and paused playtime to try and give the keeper hugs and kisses.

title: Kansas legislators impose sweeping anti-trans bathroom law
description: Republican legislators in Kansas have enacted possibly the most sweeping transgender bathroom law in the U.S. The GOP-controlled Legislature on Thursday overrode Democratic Gov. Laura Kelly's veto of the measure

title: E. Jean Carroll to face cross-examination in her lawsuit against Trump
description: Carroll testified for nearly three-and-a-half hours on Wednesday.

title: Jerry Springer, longtime talk show host, dies at 79
description: Jerry Springer, the longtime talk show host, has died at age 79, according to The Associated Press.

title: Pentagon leak suspect Jack Teixeira requests release from detention
description: Massachusetts Air National Guardsman Jack Teixeira, who is accused of leaking highly classified U.S. intelligence documents, will return to federal court on Thursday.

title: Firearms official, gun club probed over Hamburg shooting
description: German prosecutors say they are investigating an official at Hamburg’s firearms department and three members of a gun club in connection with a mass shooting at a Jehovah’s Witness hall last month

title: US Navy says Iran seized Marshall Islands-flagged oil tanker
description: The U.S. Navy says Iran has seized a Marshall Islands-flagged oil tanker in the Gulf of Oman amid wider tensions over Tehran’s nuclear program

title: Jobless claims fall again with labor market churning along
description: Applications for unemployment benefits in the U.S. fell last week as the labor market continues to show strength despite some weakness in other parts of the economy

title: Former Czech soccer head gets prison term for fraud
description: The former head of the Czech Republic soccer association has been convicted of fraud and sentenced to six years in prison

title: US economic growth slowed significantly at start of 2023
description: U.S. gross domestic product grew by a 1.1% annualized rate over the three months ending in March, data showed.

title: Supreme Court takes on what critics call predatory tax foreclosure practice
description: The Supreme Court is reviewing a practice where the government will take someone's home to pay a tax debt -- then, when it's resold, keep more money than the taxes owed.

title: Search underway for man overboard on cruise ship hundreds of miles away from Hawaii
description: The United States Coast Guard is searching for a cruise ship passenger from Australia who went overboard a few hundred miles off the coast of Hawaii.

title: WATCH:  Bear stuck up tree saved by firefighters
description: Rescuers caught a bear that fell after being stuck up a tree. It will be released back into the wild.

title: WATCH:  Charity helps Ukrainian children have fun again
description: Volunteers are trying to help children displaced and traumatized by war experience joy again.

title: Prosecutors say docs leak suspect Jack Teixeira a flight risk ahead of hearing
description: Jack Teixeira, 21, is due in federal court in Worcester, Massachusetts, Thursday for a detention hearing.

title: US adult cigarette smoking rate hits new all-time low
description: U.S. adults are smoking less

title: 1 dead after Amtrak train hits car on tracks in Mobile, Alabama: Police
description: Police say one person has died after an Amtrak train hit a car that was on the tracks at a Mobile, Alabama, rail crossing Wednesday night.

title: Rapper Young Thug files motion for bond as he awaits trial in RICO indictment
description: Young Thug's attorney filed a fourth motion for the rapper to be released on bond as he faces gang-related charges in a sweeping RICO indictment.

title: Judges reject Trump appeal of order for Pence to testify in Jan. 6 probe
description: A federal appeals panel on Wednesday rejected an effort from Trump to prevent Mike Pence from testifying before a special counsel

title: Republicans grill teachers' union head on COVID classroom closures
description: A divided House panel on Wednesday alternately questioned and defended Randi Weingarten on COVID-19 school closures
